When NBC named Hoda Kotb to replace Matt Lauer after sexual misconduct allegations caused his speedy exit, the network made history. Hoda and Savannah Guthrie became the first all - female co - anchor team in the 65 - year history of the Today show. But while enthusiasm for Kotb ’ s promotion resulted in public congratulations from her colleagues and media industry peers, rumors soared of a nasty feud taking place when the Today show cameras were turned off.
